alert.note: Alert for Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 6:36PM MST until June 29 at 10:15PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Arizona and west central Arizona, including the following counties, in southwest Arizona, Yuma. In west central Arizona, La Paz. * WHEN...Until 945 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 636 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in Bouse Wash. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Bouse Wash is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. This includes the following streams and drainages... Cementosa Wash, Alamo Wash and Calcite Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northern Yuma and East Central La Paz Counties - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
